mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Mulberry Health Center Album -- Nutrition Class

mods:mods.mods:abstract: Annotation on back: From: Mulberry Health Center Album

Description: #4003 Unknown Photographer From: Mulberry Health Center Album In AICP 75th "Annual Report 1918" (1917-1918), page 18. Caption: NUTRITION CLASS. A group of underweight children attending a nutrition clinic. This particular clinic is held in a school. Others are held in Milk Stations. The child comes each week and is weighed. At this time the child's chart is marked. Special stars are awarded and placed on the charts of children who have made the largest gain, who have eaten meals regularly, who have given up coffee, and so forth. The charts of some of the children are seen on the walls. The dietitian is here shown instructing the children as to the respective values of different foods. In AICP pamphlet "Developing Child Health via Community Organization," c1919, page 15. Caption: One of our nutrition classes in a public school. These children meet the nutrition worker once a week after school hours.

mods:relatedItem.mods:note: New York Association for Improving the Condition of the Poor, Annual Report 75 (New York: 1918): 18; New York Association for Improving the Condition of the Poor, Developing Child Health via Community Organization (New York: 1919): 15

mods:location.mods:physicalLocation: Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Columbia University
